input: do I have to have Boating safety certificates ?
gold_answer: In New York, anyone operating a Personal Watercraft (JetSki™, Wave Runner™, etc.) must have a boating safety certificate and be at least 14 years of age or older. Starting in 2024, if you are operating any other type of motorized boat, you will need a safety certificate if you were born on or after January 1, 1978. Starting in 2025, all operators of motorized vessels, regardless of age, will be required to have a safety certificate. However, if you are renting a boat, you do not need a safety certificate if you are at least 18 years old, although the livery must demonstrate how to properly use the boat before renting it. Persons under the age of 18 may only rent a motorboat if they hold a safety certificate.

Boating Frequently Asked Questions

Home / Boating / Education / Frequently Asked Questions

New York Safe Boating Education Program

Boating Safety Certificates
Who needs a boating safety certificate?
	Anyone operating a Personal Watercraft (JetSki™, Wave Runner™, etc.) must have a boating safety certificate, and be at least 14 years of age or older.
In 2024: If you are operating any other type of motorized boat, you will need a safety certificate if you were born January 1, 1978 or later. Starting in 2025, all operators of motorized vessels, regardless of age, will be required to have a safety certificate.
I earned a state safety certificate when I was young. Does that count?
	We do not have all course records prior to 2000. Any certificate issued prior to 2000 is only acceptable if you have a copy of it and you were under 18 years of age when it was issued. All NYS boating safety certificates issued
	after 2000, regardless of age, are acceptable.
I took course prior to 2000, but lost my certificate - what should I do?
	Unfortunately, we do not have records for all students who took the course prior to the year 2000.

retrieved_contexts.text:
Boating Frequently Asked Questions - NYS Parks, Recreation & Historic Preservation

No. If you are at least 18 years old, you may rent without completing a course. The livery must demonstrate how to properly use the boat before renting it. Persons under the age of 18 may only rent a motorboat if they hold a 
	safety certificate.
I lost my safety certificate. How can I get a replacement?
	You can order your replacement certificate online at https://www.ilostmycard.com/
What if I lost my temporary certificate?
	Temporary certificates cannot be replaced.
Can I make a copy of my Boating Safety Certificate to keep onboard my boat?
	No, you must have the original certificate on your person or on board the boat if you are the operator.
Why haven't I received my safety certificate yet?
	It takes approximately 90 days from your course completion date for your permanent certificate to arrive in the mail. Your temporary certificate is valid through those 90 days. If you are over 18 years of age, you must purchase your certificate from https://www.ilostmycard.com/ before it will be mailed to you. If you are within 7 days of your temporary certificate’s expiration date and have not yet received your card, please email us at boating@parks.ny.gov
How can I become an instructor?
	To become a State certified instructor, you must be at least 18 years of age, be able to demonstrate an ability to instruct and must have taken a New York State Parks classroom course. For more information, or to begin the certification process, click here
I have a US Coast Guard Auxiliary boating safety certificate. Can I exchange it for a New York boating safety certificate?
	A boating safety certificate issued by the US Coast Guard Auxiliary is recognized as a valid safe boating certificate – you do not need any further documentation. The same is true of certificates issued by the US Power Squadron/America’s Boating Club.
I took a class online and I have lost my permanent card, can you issue me a replacement card?
	You need to go to the online provider that issued your card. The same is true for lost Power Squadron and Coast Guard Auxiliary cards. NYS can only issue replacement certificates for the NY Safe Boating Course.
